fr:frontmatter.fr:title: Nilpotent connections and the monodromy theorem. Applications of a result of Turritin
fr:frontmatter.fr:meta: @article{K1971, author = {Katz, N.}, title = {{Nilpotent connections and the monodromy theorem. Applications of a result of Turritin}}, journal = {Publ. Math. IH\'{E}S}, volume = {39}, year = {1971}, pages = {175--232}, }

fr:mainmatter.fr:p:
(cf. [K1971]). Let S be a smooth connected scheme, s\in S a point, f\colon X\to S a proper smooth morphism, and P a direct factor of the local system \mathrm {R}^i f_*\mathbb {Q}, which is pointwise a Hodge sub-structure. Then the following conditions are equivalent:
The Hodge structure of P is locally constant.
The representation P_s of \pi _1(S,s) factors through a finite quotient of \pi _1(S,s).
There exists a finite non-empty étale covering u\colon S'\to S such that u^*P is a constant family of Hodge structures.
